metadata.title: CVE-2017-15396 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A stack buffer overflow in NumberingSystem in International Components forUnicode (ICU) for C/C++ before 60.2, as used in V8 in Google Chrome priorto 62.0.3202.75 and other products, allowed a remote attacker topotentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15396` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 62.0.3202.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1313
chromium-browser-l10n - 62.0.3202.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1313
chromium-chromedriver - 62.0.3202.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1313
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 62.0.3202.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1313
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 62.0.3202.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1313
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3202.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1313').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
